intro: Kermadecia pinnatifida, commonly known as the Kermadec bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty sea breezes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Kermadecia pinnatifida is an important part of the local flora and is often found in coastal vegetation communities.
